source: Our planning system also needs to adapt so that planners in suburban councils, who seem to be less supportive of change, are not the only determinants of the future shape of their suburbs. A way forward could be to have an independent decision-making body that championed quality design as long as it fitted below the tree tops and incorporated family living, large balconies, common gardens and presented a friendly appearance. This could be a role for the current NSW government architect working within a carefully crafted complying code.
hypothesis: 我们的规划系统也需要调整，以避免那些似乎不太支持变革的郊区委员会规划人员成为其郊区未来形态的唯一决定因素。未来的一个方向可以是设立一个独立的决策机构，该机构倡导高质量设计，只要设计高度低于树顶，并包含家庭居住空间、大型阳台、公共花园，且外观友善。这可能是当前新南威尔士州政府建筑师在精心制定的合规规范内可以发挥的作用。
reference: 我们的规划体系也需要调整，使郊区市政委员会的规划者（他们似乎不太支持变革）不再一手把持郊区未来形态的话语权。未来的方向可能是建立独立的决策机构来大力倡导优质设计：高度在树顶以下，融入家庭生活设施、大阳台、公共花园和友好外观。这也许是目前新南威尔士州政府的建筑专家在精心制定的合规规范中能够发挥的作用。

source: The protests were ostensibly set off by the government's decision to end subsidies for diesel fuel used in agriculture and to cut an exemption from car tax for farm vehicles. These measures pushed farmers over the edge. It also mobilised other angry workers, already straining under the pressure of inflation, recession and the government's self-imposed austerity. On January 9th drivers of freight and passenger trains at Deutsche Bahn, the national railway, began a strike over working hours and pay.
hypothesis: 抗议活动表面上是由政府的决定引发的，该决定旨在结束对农业用柴油燃料的补贴，并取消农用车辆的车税豁免。这些措施使农民忍无可忍。这也动员了其他愤怒的工人，他们已经在通货膨胀、经济衰退和政府自行实施的紧缩政策的压力下苦苦挣扎。1月9日，德国国家铁路公司Deutsche Bahn的货运和客运列车司机开始罢工，原因是工作时间和工资问题。
reference: 表面上看，抗议活动的导火索是政府决定终止对农用柴油的补贴，并削减对农用车辆的汽车税豁免。这些措施让农民忍无可忍。这也带动了一些愤怒的工人，他们在通货膨胀、经济衰退和政府自我实施的紧缩政策的压力下苦苦挣扎。1 月 9 日，德国国家铁路公司的货运和客运列车司机就工作时间和工资问题举行罢工。

source: Adapt the old, accommodate the new to solve issue At the precinct level, we just need to look at the Sydney CBD as an example of an area which has grown from its pre-settlement landscape into a two-storey city, from a maximum height of 150 feet to the soaring towers of today. At a much scaled-down level, the same can occur across Sydney's town centres located around transport nodes. Inner suburbs must also evolve, with a swing to more affordable apartment living at heights below the tree tops on key sites. Of course, the new growth in housing needs to be well-designed and trees, landscaping and parks need to be included along with other essential infrastructure.
hypothesis: 适应旧有，容纳新变，以解决问题。在区域层面，我们只需以悉尼中央商务区为例，该区域已从其定居前的地貌发展成为一个两层楼的城市，从最高150英尺的高度发展到今天的摩天大楼。在规模小得多的层面上，同样的情况也可能发生在悉尼位于交通枢纽周围的城镇中心。内城区也必须发展，在主要地段转向树顶以下的更经济适用的公寓生活。当然，新的住房增长需要精心设计，并且需要包括树木、景观和公园以及其他必要的基础设施。
reference: 改造旧居所，容纳新移民，解决居住问题 在区域层面，我们只需要以悉尼中央商务区为例。这个地区一路走来，从原生地貌到两层民居，再从最高不过150英尺的建筑，到如今高耸入云的摩天楼。在更小的尺度上，交通枢纽周边的悉尼市区各中心也可能遵循同样的发展路径。近郊也必须发展起来，在关键地段建设低于树顶高度、更经济适用的公寓楼。当然，新开发的住房需要精心设计，综合考量树木、景观、公园以及其他必要的基础设施。

source: In an effort to defuse the tension with the farmers, the government agreed to a gradual removal of the diesel subsidy over three years and to keeping the exemption from the car tax. The farmers pooh-poohed the concessions as insufficient. On January 4th an aggressive group of them prevented Robert Habeck, the economy minister, from disembarking from a ferry on his return from a family holiday. If the train drivers are similarly unimpressed, that could prove expensive for German business, reckons IW Köln, a think-tank. The rail strike could cost businesses €100m ($110m) a day if it forced them to interrupt production. The car, chemical and steel industries, Germany's biggest, are especially reliant on rail transport.
hypothesis: 为了缓和与农民的紧张关系，政府同意在三年内逐步取消柴油补贴，并保留汽车税的豁免。农民们对这些让步嗤之以鼻，认为它们不足够。1月4日，一群激进的农民阻止了经济部长罗伯特·哈贝克在结束家庭度假后从渡轮上下来。如果火车司机同样不为所动，IW Köln智库认为，这可能会给德国企业带来高昂的代价。如果铁路罢工迫使企业中断生产，每天可能给企业造成1亿欧元（1.1亿美元）的损失。德国最大的汽车、化工和钢铁行业尤其依赖铁路运输。
reference: 为了缓和与农民之间的紧张关系，政府同意在三年内逐步取消柴油补贴，并保留汽车税的豁免政策。农民们对这些让步嗤之以鼻，认为远远不够。1 月 4 日，经济部长罗伯特·哈贝克在结束家庭假期后，乘坐渡轮返回时，遭到一群激进分子的阻拦，无法下船。智库 IW Köln 认为，如果火车司机也对政府的方案不买账，那么对德国企业来说，代价可能十分高昂。如果铁路罢工迫使企业中断生产，每天可能造成 1 亿欧元（1.1 亿美元）的损失。作为德国的支柱产业，汽车、化工和钢铁行业尤其依赖铁路运输。

source: German farmers and train drivers are scaring Germany's bosses In Germany, where workers and bosses run many companies jointly, a big strike is unusual. A wave of big strikes is almost unheard of. Right now the country of "co-determination" is simultaneously facing an eight-day "action week" by irate farmers, who blocked roads with tractors, a three-day strike of railway workers and, to top it off, a looming strike of doctors, who already closed surgeries between Christmas and New Year's Day. This Mistgabelmop (pitchfork mob), as some have taken to calling it, will test Germany's harmonious labour relations in the year to come.
hypothesis: 德国农民和火车司机正在震慑德国的老板们。在德国，工人和老板共同管理许多公司，因此大规模罢工并不常见。一波大规模罢工更是闻所未闻。现在，这个实行“共同决定”制度的国家正同时面临着愤怒的农民发起的为期八天的“行动周”，他们用拖拉机封锁道路；铁路工人为期三天的罢工；更糟糕的是，医生们也即将举行罢工，他们已经在圣诞节和新年之间关闭了诊所。这个被一些人称为“Mistgabelmop（干草叉暴民）”的群体，将在未来一年考验德国和谐的劳资关系。
reference: 德国农民和火车司机让老板们心惊肉跳 在德国，许多公司都由工人和老板共同经营，大规模罢工并不常见。多行业大规模罢工潮更是闻所未闻。现在，这个“共同决策”的国家正面临着愤怒农民长达八天的“行动周”，他们用拖拉机封锁了道路；铁路工人也举行了为期三天的罢工；更糟糕的是，医生们可能也要举行罢工，他们已经在圣诞节和元旦期间关闭了诊所。一些人称之为“干草叉暴民”（Mistgabelmop），这场风暴将在未来一年考验德国和谐的劳资关系。

source: Shifts in thought are harder to quantify than bank loans for rural women or school enrollment for girls. Yet there is plenty of evidence that female agency can move mountains. In Iran, for example, women have led the greatest threat to the Islamic government in 40 years simply by refusing to comply with laws that force them to cover their hair. In some of the 130 countries with minimum quotas for female representation in government, such as India, male resistance to female voting and political activism has eased. In some rural African communities, civil society organizations are replacing a harmful rite of passage with health education. One such program helped Kamanda Timayio, leader of the Masai village of Maparasha, Kenya, change his mind about female genital mutilation. He told Le Monde that he had "emerged from ignorance" and would abandon the practice.
hypothesis: 思想观念的转变比农村妇女获得的银行贷款或女孩的入学率更难量化。然而，有大量证据表明，女性的自主性能够移山。例如，在伊朗，女性仅仅因为拒绝遵守强迫她们遮盖头发的法律，就对伊斯兰政府构成了 40 年来最大的威胁。在一些对政府女性代表实行最低配额的 130 个国家，例如印度，男性对女性投票和政治行动主义的抵制有所缓解。在一些非洲农村社区，公民社会组织正在用健康教育取代有害的成人礼。其中一个项目帮助肯尼亚马帕拉沙马赛村的领导人卡曼达·蒂迈约改变了他对女性生殖器切割的看法。他告诉《世界报》说，他已经“摆脱了愚昧”，并将放弃这种做法。
reference: 与向农村妇女提供银行贷款或提高女童入学率相比，思维方式的转变更难量化。但有大量证据表明，女性的力量可以移山倒海。例如，在伊朗，女性仅仅因为拒绝遵守强制她们佩戴头巾的法律，就对伊斯兰政府构成了 40 年来最大的威胁。在全球范围内，在印度等 130 个对女性在政府机构中的人数设定了下限的国家，男性对女性投票和参政的阻力有所减弱。 在一些非洲农村社区，民间社会组织正在用健康教育取代有害的成年礼。其中一个项目帮助肯尼亚马帕拉沙马赛村的村长卡曼达·蒂马约改变了对女性割礼的看法。他告诉《世界报》，他已经“摆脱了愚昧”，并将放弃这种做法。

source: A final push for female equality Last year, the World Economic Forum forecast that it would take five generations to achieve gender equality in every nation. Now the World Bank wants to rapidly accelerate that time frame. The international financial institution is poised to launch a strategy aimed at significantly advancing the rights and economic opportunities for girls and women by 2030. The plan focuses on improving inclusivity and resilience through access to finance, technological innovation, and changes in public policy and law. "Recent research demonstrates that both social norms and mindsets can change, for example, that engaging men and boys can foster their support and buy-in for gender equality," a consultative draft of the plan states. "Positive gender outcomes can be accelerated and scaled with a better understanding of ... how social norms and mindsets shape everyday expectations, priorities, and practices."
hypothesis: 在实现女性平等方面做出最后的努力。 去年，世界经济论坛预测，在每个国家实现性别平等需要五代人的时间。 现在，世界银行希望迅速缩短这一时限。 该国际金融机构准备启动一项战略，旨在到2030年显著提高女孩和妇女的权利和经济机会。 该计划的重点是通过获得金融、技术创新以及公共政策和法律的变革来提高包容性和复原力。“最近的研究表明，社会规范和思维模式是可以改变的，例如，让男性和男孩参与进来可以促进他们对性别平等的支持和认同，”该计划的协商草案指出。“通过更好地理解……社会规范和思维模式如何塑造日常的期望、优先事项和实践，可以加速和扩大积极的性别结果。”
reference: 为女性平等奋力一搏 去年，世界经济论坛预测，全球实现性别平等需要五代人的时间。现在，世界银行希望迅速加快这一进程。 这家国际金融机构准备推出一项战略，旨在到 2030 年大幅提升女童和妇女的权利和经济机会。该计划的重点是通过资金支持、技术创新以及公共政策和法律变革，提高包容性和韧性。 “最近的研究表明，社会规范和思维方式都可以改变，例如，让成年和未成年的男性参与进来，可以培养他们对性别平等的支持和认同，”该计划的一份咨询草案指出，“如果能更好地了解社会规范和思维方式如何塑造日常期望、优先事项和行为方式，就能加快实现和扩大积极的性别平等成果。”

source: Over the past decade, our lives have changed through technology, with many working from home, and Sydney has gained an impressive network of metro and light rail systems. Our ability to purchase online has changed the way we shop, and friends and family seem closer because of smartphone communication. All of these adaptations from one system to another can also occur in our built environment through a planning focus on adaptive reuse rather than preferencing heritage preservation. Chris Johnson is a former NSW government architect (1995-2005) and executive director, NSW Department of Planning (2005-2009). He was CEO of Urban Taskforce Australia between 2011 and 2019.
hypothesis: 在过去十年里，我们的生活因科技而发生了改变，许多人开始在家工作，悉尼也拥有了令人印象深刻的地铁和轻轨系统网络。我们在网上购物的能力改变了我们的购物方式，而智能手机的通讯让亲友之间的联系似乎更加紧密。所有这些从一个系统到另一个系统的适应，也可能发生在我们的建筑环境中，通过规划侧重于适应性再利用，而不是优先考虑遗产保护。克里斯·约翰逊曾任新南威尔士州政府建筑师（1995-2005年）和新南威尔士州规划部执行董事（2005-2009年）。他于2011年至2019年间担任澳大利亚城市工作组的首席执行官。
reference: 在过去的十年里，科技改变了我们的生活，许多人开始在家工作，悉尼也建成了令人印象深刻的地铁和轻轨网络。网购改变了我们的购物方式，智能手机的普及也拉近了朋友和家人之间的距离。同样地，如果城市规划的重点放在建筑的活化再利用上，而不是一味优先考虑老建筑保护，我们业已成型的环境也可以实现这样的转变和适应，实现系统层面的变革。 克里斯·约翰逊曾任新南威尔士州政府建筑专家（1995-2005 年）和新南威尔士州规划部执行主任（2005-2009 年）。2011 年至 2019 年，他曾担任澳大利亚城市特别工作组的首席执行官。

source: Siso's depictions of land, water center new gallery exhibition "People Swimming in the Swimming Pool" from 2022 is one Vicente Siso artwork that will display at Tierra del Sol Gallery beginning Jan. 13. (photo courtesy of Vicente Siso) Tierra del Sol is pleased to present "Vicente Siso: Memories of the Land and Water" at the new gallery location in West Hollywood. Siso has been an artist in the Studio Arts Program since 2012, this marks his debut solo exhibition. Siso was born 1962 in Madrid and raised between Venezuela, Trinidad and Miami; he moved with his family to Southern California in his early 20s.
hypothesis: 西索对土地和水的描绘是2022年新画廊展览“在游泳池里游泳的人们”的中心，这是Vicente Siso的艺术作品之一，将于1月13日起在Tierra del Sol画廊展出。(照片由Vicente Siso提供) Tierra del Sol很高兴在西好莱坞的新画廊举办“Vicente Siso: 土地和水的记忆”展览。自2012年以来，西索一直是工作室艺术项目的艺术家，这次展览是他的首次个人展览。西索于1962年出生于马德里，在委内瑞拉、特立尼达和迈阿密长大；20多岁时随家人搬到南加州。
reference: 西索描绘陆与水的画作成为新画廊展览的焦点 2022 年创作的《泳池戏水》是维森特·西索的一幅作品，将于 1 月 13 日起在 Tierra del Sol 画廊展出。（图片由维森特·西索提供） Tierra del Sol 画廊荣幸地在西好莱坞的新址推出“维森特·西索：水与陆的记忆”展览。西索自 2012 年起成为“工作室艺术项目”的艺术家，本次展览是他的首次个展。西索 1962 年出生于马德里，童年在委内瑞拉、特立尼达和迈阿密之间辗转，20 岁出头时随家人移居南加州。

source: The World Bank cites other examples. From 1970 to 2022, Bangladesh quadrupled female literacy rates and doubled female participation in the labor force. Its gross domestic product more than tripled. The change gathered its own momentum. Recruiting salaried women as teachers and health workers from within their own communities boosted trust "and made women's mobility and work more socially acceptable." The bank's plan would target norms and institutions that may still require generational shifts. It has taken Rwanda more than two decades to establish itself as a model for land reforms that boost economic empowerment for women."No one benefits if women are held back," Rwanda President Paul Kagame said, arguing for land reform in 2015. "We have to change mindsets, not just the laws." The World Bank hopes to spread that message.
hypothesis: 世界银行引用了其他例子。从1970年到2022年，孟加拉国的女性识字率增加了三倍，女性劳动力参与率增加了一倍。其国内生产总值增长了两倍多。这种变化形成了自身势头。从社区内部招聘有薪女性担任教师和卫生工作者，增强了信任，“并使女性的流动和工作在社会上更易于接受。” 世界银行的计划将针对可能仍需要几代人才能转变的规范和制度。卢旺达花了二十多年的时间才把自己确立为土地改革的典范，从而促进了妇女的经济赋权。卢旺达总统保罗·卡加梅在2015年呼吁土地改革时说：“如果妇女受到阻碍，没有人会受益。” “我们必须改变观念，而不仅仅是法律。” 世界银行希望传播这一信息。
reference: 世界银行还列举了其他例子。从 1970 年到 2022 年，孟加拉国女性识字率翻了两番，女性劳动力参与率翻了一番。其国内生产总值增长了两倍多。这种变化积聚了动力。从社区内部招募女性担任有薪教师和卫生工作者的做法增强了信任，“并使女性的流动和工作在社会上更容易被接受。” 世界银行的计划将针对那些可能仍需几代人才能转变的规范和制度。卢旺达花了 20 多年时间推进增强女性经济权能的土地改革，最终成为典范。“如果女性受到阻碍，没有人会受益，”卢旺达总统保罗·卡加梅在 2015 年主张土地改革时表示，“我们必须改变观念，而不仅仅是法律。” 世界银行希望传播这一理念。

source: Masterfully working across subject matter, Siso has generated a prolific series of landscapes, portraits, and still-life works rendered in either acrylic, pastel, pencil or watercolor. Drawing from family portraits, his own reference photographs, and recollection, his colorful compositions demonstrate his range of interests and skill across media. Siso's tropical landscapes and seascapes reflect the geographies of his past, employing rich patterns and incorporating people to make meaningful connections between culture, memory and the environment. Siso titles his artworks in a mix of Spanish and English, signifying the celebrated and integral complexities of his life in Los Angeles County. "Vicente Siso: Memories of the Land and Water" opens on Saturday, Jan. 13, with a reception from 6-8 p.m. The exhibition is on view through Sunday, March 3. The Tierra del Sol Gallery is located at 7414 Santa Monica Blvd. For information, visit tierradelsolgallery.org.

source: What we found demonstrates that immediate action is required. Even accounting for Washington's population growth, the Washington jail death rate nearly tripled between 2000 and 2019 - an increase 16 times that of the national average. Outpacing other states, Washington now has the fourth-highest rate of jail deaths in the nation. This cannot continue. Reversing the trend of jail deaths, and solving the many other issues facing our jails, may require some difficult policy decisions. However, independent oversight of jails is a critical first step toward a safer and more humane jail system. Independent oversight is a demonstrated means of improving transparency and accountability both in Washington and across the country. By our count, at least 25 states have a statewide office responsible for overseeing jails, and all of them have a lower rate of jail deaths than Washington.

source: Bring back oversight for WA's jails. Lives depend on it The Washington jail system is experiencing a fatality crisis. This is one of the uncomfortable but unavoidable truths we confronted as co-chairs of a legislative task force charged with studying our state's jail system and recommending changes to help make jails safer. Although we come from a variety of backgrounds, including jail administration, civil rights advocacy, and experience being incarcerated in jail, we all agree that there must be independent oversight of Washington's jails. More than 130,000 people were booked into a Washington jail in 2022, and yet there is startlingly little information about what occurs once they get there. Washington has no statewide office responsible for monitoring jails and reporting data to the public. Some of the only information available relates to deaths in custody.

source: Closer to home, Washington has recently established or expanded independent oversight of state prisons, police, schools, and other entities. Jails are the notable exception to oversight of institutions that are responsible for the health and safety of tens of thousands of people. An independent jail oversight office can monitor conditions in jails, meet with staff and incarcerated people, report on conditions that they have witnessed firsthand, and even communicate concerns before people are hurt. A jail oversight office can also collect and report data, helping administrators, policymakers, and the public understand our jail system and advocate for data-driven solutions to jail deaths and other problems relating to jails. Oversight is not only for the benefit of incarcerated people. Our task force recognized that an oversight office can partner with overburdened jail systems to provide much-needed assistance and recommendations, including smart policies that promote staff safety and reduce recidivism.

source: Washington state briefly had a statewide jail oversight office from 1981-87, which the United States Department of Justice once trumpeted as a model for systems around the country. Unfortunately, the Legislature eliminated statewide jail oversight over the objections of jail administrators, civil rights groups, and others. Independent oversight will promote public trust and data-driven decision-making in a field that has for too long operated without the benefit of transparency. We ask the Legislature to enact into law our task force's recommendation to restore independent oversight of our state's city, county, and regional jails. People's lives depend on it. Hailey Ockinga is an anti-incarceration activist and community organizer, and the executive director of Beyond These Walls in Washington state. source: How Betta Edu became a scapegoat of a dysfunctional political system In a recent incident involving Betta Edu, the Minister of Humanitarian Affairs and Poverty Alleviation in President Bola Ahmed Tinubu's administration, there have been calls for her removal from office amid allegations of misappropriation of a N585 million palliative fund. The minister has faced significant public backlash following the exposure of a leaked memo where she purportedly instructed Oluwatoyin Madein, the Accountant-General (AG) of the federation, to transfer N585 million to a private account. As per the leaked memo dated 20 December 2023, Edu directed the Accountant-General to transfer the funds from the account of the National Social Investment Office to the private account of Bridget Oniyelu, the accountant of a Federal Government poverty intervention project called "Grants for Vulnerable Groups," a project under Mrs. Edu's ministry.

source: i think a lot about how millennials were the last generation to be able to grow connections with artists without the pressure to impose a critical eye. we came up during a golden age of media, with a collective consciousness around pop culture that no longer exists. we got to jump right into things without having to consider the source, because it wasn't as easy to determine. with no reason to question the pedestal we put them on, those parasocial relationships became prominent building blocks that shaped our lives. this is why we have such strong ties to nostalgia. when The Office was still on the air, my friends and i would order pizza and get together to watch it every thursday.
hypothesis: 我一直在思考，千禧一代是最后一批能够在没有批判性眼光压力下与艺术家建立联系的一代。我们成长于媒体的黄金时代，对流行文化有着如今已不复存在的集体意识。我们可以直接进入状态，而无需考虑来源，因为当时确定来源并不容易。由于没有理由质疑我们把他们 поставленную 他们推崇的地位，那些准社会关系成为了塑造我们人生的重要基石。这就是为什么我们对怀旧有着如此强烈的情感。当《办公室》还在播出时，我的朋友们和我每周四都会点披萨，聚在一起观看。
reference: 我经常想，千禧一代也许是最后一代能够纯粹地欣赏艺术、与艺术家建立联系的人了。他们没有那种压力，不必戴着批判性的有色眼镜去审视一切。 我们成长于媒体的黄金时代，那时的人们对流行文化有着共同的理解，而如今，这种集体意识已经消失了。 那时候，我们不用考虑内容的来源，就能直接沉浸其中，因为在那个年代，追根溯源并非易事。 我们把这些艺术家奉若神明，而且也没有任何理由去质疑这种崇拜。于是，我们和他们之间建立起了一种“拟社会关系”，并将其视为人生中不可或缺的一部分。 这也解释了为什么我们如此迷恋怀旧。 《办公室》这部剧还在播的时候，我和朋友们每周四都会聚在一起，一边吃披萨一边追剧。

source: we get trapped in cycles of discovering new media only to find out the artist is a predator or bigot. we are forced to grapple with holding onto nostalgia while acknowledging that the people who created the art we connected with can be extremely flawed. we step into parasocial relationships more gingerly. we understand that it is hard to get to these positions of wealth and power without stepping on others along the way. in the absence of collective consciousness around media, we developed a level of class consciousness that helps us stay critical. some of us are still putting people on pedestals only to act shocked when they fall. we are in a period of flux and i am anxious to discover where we might settle. @user11 Inclusion and safety should be the default.
hypothesis: 我们不断陷入循环：发现新媒介，却又发现艺术家是掠夺者或偏执狂。我们不得不努力在保留怀旧之情的同时，承认与我们产生共鸣的艺术创作者可能存在严重缺陷。我们更加谨慎地进入准社会关系。我们明白，要达到这些财富和权力地位，很难不踩着别人往上爬。在缺乏对媒体的集体意识的情况下，我们发展出一种阶级意识，帮助我们保持批判性思维。我们中的一些人仍然将人们捧上神坛，结果在他们跌落时表现得震惊。我们正处于一个动荡时期，我渴望发现我们最终会走向何方。@user11 包容和安全应该是默认设置。
reference: 我们一次又一次地发现新的媒体、新的艺术家，结果却发现他们要么是劣迹斑斑的性侵者，要么是满口偏见的顽固分子，如此循环往复，令人厌倦。 我们一方面沉溺于怀旧之中，另一方面又不得不承认，那些创作了我们所钟爱的艺术作品的人，也许在道德上存在着严重的缺陷，这种矛盾的心理令我们感到无所适从。 我们会更加小心翼翼地与艺术家建立“拟社会关系”。 我们逐渐意识到，一个人如果想要获得财富和权力，就很难保证自己不会去伤害别人、利用别人。 由于媒体的集体意识已经不复存在，我们形成了一种阶级意识，这有助于我们保持批判性思维。 当然，也有些人至今仍执迷不悟，非要把别人捧上神坛，等到偶像倒塌的时候，又装出一副震惊不已的样子。 我们正处于一个变革的时代，我迫切地想知道我们将走向何方。 @user11  包容和安全应该是默认的。

source: it was unlike anything we have now with streaming, where 12 episodes are dropped at once and everyone watches at their own pace, prefacing social media posts with “spoiler alerts” or keeping discussion in specified silos. we subconsciously crave tapping into the universal community that used to surround it all. it’s why so many of us are still obsessively watching shows like The Office, or movies like Anchorman that provided endless one-line references in a meme-like fashion. we parroted these references back and forth to one another with the assumption that most people would get it. these days, even when something goes viral on a massive scale, we can’t assume everyone has seen it. there is too much to focus on and no way to streamline it … will we ever escape the oversaturation?
hypothesis: 这与我们现在流媒体的观看方式截然不同，流媒体一次性放出12集，每个人都按照自己的节奏观看，在社交媒体帖子前加上“剧透警告”，或者将讨论限制在特定的圈子里。我们潜意识里渴望融入过去那种普世社群。这就是为什么我们仍然痴迷地观看像《办公室》这样的电视剧，或者像《王牌播音员》这样的电影，它们以类似表情包的方式提供了无尽的经典台词。我们互相鹦鹉学舌般地重复这些引语，并假设大多数人都能理解。如今，即使某件事在很大范围内走红，我们也无法假设每个人都看过。需要关注的事情太多了，而且没有办法简化它……我们能摆脱这种过度饱和的状态吗？
reference: 这与我们现在使用流媒体观看节目的体验截然不同。流媒体平台通常一次性放出 12 集，每个人都按照自己的节奏观看，在社交媒体上发帖讨论剧情时还要加上“剧透预警”，或者干脆只在特定的群组里交流。 在潜意识里，我们都渴望重温那种将所有人联系在一起的集体归属感。 也正是因为怀旧情结作祟，我们才会一遍又一遍地重温《办公室》之类的电视剧，或《王牌播音员》之类的电影，这些作品中那些令人过耳不忘的经典台词，就像模因一样在网上广为流传。 我们会互相引用这些作品中的经典台词，并且认为大部分人都能心领神会。 如今，就算某些东西在网上爆火，我们也不能想当然地认为每个人都看过。 现在信息爆炸，需要我们关注的东西实在太多了，根本没法精简……我们还有机会摆脱这种信息过载的状态吗？

hypothesis: 这个问题很小众，但现在如果你对组装/定制小型机器人模型感兴趣，就*必须*做成用于战争和杀戮的东西，这有点糟糕。就像00年代的Bionicles，它们本质上是拥有元素力量、鲜明个性和爱好的冒险家/英雄。但像那之前和之后的东西，比如Warhammer、Gundam、Battletech，一切都以武器为导向，并在相关媒体中被过度展示。当然，这些也意识到“战争是坏的”，但你仍然在销售杀人机器的模型和周边。所以，我们到底在干什么？我猜答案就是把设计和它的虚构意图分开，人们对现实世界的坦克和喷气机就是这么做的，但我的大脑很难接受这一点。
reference: 这是一个很小众的问题，但如今的现状确实令人无奈：如果你对制作/定制小型机器人模型感兴趣，就一定会接触到那些专为战争和杀戮而设计的机器人。 就像 21 世纪初的生化战士系列，这些机器人本质上是拥有元素力量的冒险家/英雄，每个角色都有着鲜明的个性和爱好。而除此之外，无论是之前还是之后，市面上的机器人系列几乎都充满了战争和杀戮的味道，例如《战锤》《高达》《战斗机甲》等等，所有的一切都成了武器，并在各种衍生作品中被肆意渲染。 诚然，这些机器人系列也意识到了“战争是不好的”，但它们仍然在销售那些杀戮机器的模型和周边产品。那么，我们这样做究竟是为了什么呢？ 我想，解决这个问题的办法就是把机器人的设计和它在虚构作品中的用途区分开来，毕竟现实世界中的坦克和战斗机也有人用来收藏，但我的大脑一时之间还是难以接受这种割裂感。

source: Initially, I wasn't sure if the internet in our garden would be good enough for this setup. The old access points I replaced last year in the fall wouldn't have cut it. But the new ones cover that area just fine. That is almost a bummer because I was planning on mounting a TP-Link cpe210 on the roof and having it point downwards to the garden. I still might do that when/if I set up more camera nesting boxes. Especially in areas further from the house, I might need it. Now, for reasons I'm not sure about yet, the camera is offline. It went out only one hour after sunset. Maybe it stopped charging the battery 3 hours before sunset due to insufficient light. Maybe it couldn't fully charge up in a little less than half a day. I guess I'll see what happens tomorrow.

source: So either there's something wrong with this panel or my multimeter, or they changed the listing. Good news everyone! They changed the listing and the one I have is borked. Both the old and the new Listing titles call it a 12V 10W panel. This is why I don't delete old emails. Hey, look: the thing went back online for like half a minute about one hour ago. Maybe the panel trickle-charged the battery just enough for 38 seconds of runtime. It only took a bit over two hours to do that. Guess what: It's cloudy today. So I'm not sure if that (probably broken) solar panel is able to generate enough juice to achieve anything. Let's wait and see. Update: I installed the new panel and now it seems to work. It still might die as soon as the sun goes down, but let's wait and see.

source: Running a business as a self-employed introverted creative and having a big heart for privacy shouldn't feel like a twist, but sometimes it is. The majority of online resources and coaches tell you to work with big (and evil) tech using extrovert techniques. Advertise here, follow the algorithm, share your personality. Get a blue tick on that service, be available 24/7, answer inquiries with a video of yourself, respond immediately. Video, video, video. It's a year of transition for me. I don't want to feed Big Tech with money, data and my energy. Or coaches who have their one extroverted solution that they apply to everyone. I'm exploring new ways of doing business, while fighting my long-held belief that you have to do things a certain way to be successful. Wish me luck! First steps are already done.
hypothesis: 作为一个内向的、有创造力的自由职业者来运营生意，并且非常注重隐私，这本不应该让人感到纠结，但有时确实如此。大多数在线资源和教练会告诉你，要使用外向的方式与大型（且邪恶的）科技公司合作。在这里做广告，遵循算法，分享你的个性。在这个服务上获得一个蓝色勾号，保持24/7全天候在线，用你的视频回复咨询，立即回复。视频，视频，视频。对我来说，今年是转型的一年。我不想用金钱、数据和精力来喂养大型科技公司。或者那些只有一种外向型解决方案并将其应用于所有人的教练。我正在探索新的经商方式，同时与我长期以来认为必须以某种方式做事才能成功的信念作斗争。祝我好运！第一步已经完成了。
reference: 作为一名自主创业的内向型创意人士，而且非常注重隐私，运营一家企业不应该让人感觉这么别扭，但有时确实如此。大多数在线资源和导师都告诉你，要以外向型方式与大型（邪恶）科技公司打交道。在这里打广告，要遵循算法，分享你的个性魅力。在那个服务上获得身份认证，保持全天候在线，用你自己的视频回答问题，并立即回复。视频，视频，还是视频。 对我来说，今年是转型之年。 我不想再把我的金钱、数据和精力奉献给大型科技公司，也不想再听那些只会把单一的外向型解决方案套用到每个人身上的导师的意见。我正在探索新的商业模式，同时也在努力克服自己长期以来的观念，即认为只有按照某种特定方式做事才能成功。 祝我好运吧！ 第一步已经迈出。

source: Yea so I flew this today. first complaint: we need cute logbooks. black is boring, pink is not even pink, it's salmon. I've wanted to fly since I was a child. And it happened today... I flew a plane today. I'm still actually processing that. data from flightaware. Going to try and get out there again this coming Saturday. Weather doesn't look good right now but it's only Monday. So the challenges in this are already showing themselves. I'm likely going to have a VERY difficult time getting a medical clearance due to the FAA's stance on certain medications. Not impossible, but it's going to take a VERY long time and require a LOT of extra work. While disheartening, it's just yet another problem to solve, and it *does* so far seem solvable. Just at great expense of time and $$.

source: In case you're interested in the challenge ahead I face. FAA isn't a fan of ADHD. Definitely won't let you get a medical cert if taking medication for it. If I ever have the opportunity to have a custom tail number for an aircraft, you KNOW it has to be some variation of N1337_, the _ being whatever final alphabetical char is available. Of course the sun is gonna be out while I'm away, lol. What a punk. I need to be in the air again. And the weather is not behaving. Welcome to General Aviation 😜 I'm getting the vibe that aviation tend to track farily conservative based on some of the ads youtube has decided I should see, videos I'm being recommended, and comments I see. If the weather behaves, I'll be flying again on Saturday. Also, I found a pink logbook.

source: Happy Saturday morning. I did this today ^_^ #TeaganAir Its log book official. I have 2.3 hours ^_^ #TeaganAir If u asked me to describe what flying a small plane is like, I'd say it's a combination of a motorcycle/ATV and a boat at 4000 ft in the air On the ground things get very fast very quickly. There's a certain Mount of instability on the ground hence motorcycle/atv. Also if you didn't know, you steer a plane on the ground with your feet, not the control yoke. Rudder pedals and brakes. It's not a car. In the air it's bumpy and floaty and feels like you're in a boat on the water. You have control, but sometimes a wave knocks you around a little bit, so u need to get your sea legs except in the air. Oh another random tidbit:

source: Flying is physical. Today I'm *sore* in my back and legs like I went to the gym. This isn't like hopping in the car for a Sunday drive stuff. It's closer to a sport than a cruise in my newly initiated opinion. Happy Saturday lovelies. Welcome to 4000ft. Going back up tomorrow and we're doing stalls and slow flight. Choppy day today, but super fun. We did slow flight and stalls. At one point we had our ground speed down to 16mph with an airspeed of 65. It was a nice clear day, a little hazy at altitude, but nice none the less. FlightAware data track. #TeaganAir #pilot #flying #pa28 #PilotTraining This stuff really is like going to the gym. I ended up taking a 2 hour nap today (just waking up) because I'm physically tired. I'm also rly sore, especially my legs. LOTS of right rudder today.
hypothesis: 飞行是体力活。今天我背部和腿部酸痛，就像去了健身房一样。这不像开车兜风那么轻松。在我看来，它更像是一项运动，而不是一次巡航。周六快乐，各位。欢迎来到4000英尺。明天还要上去，我们将进行失速和慢速飞行。今天有点颠簸，但超级有趣。我们做了慢速飞行和失速。有一次，我们的地速降到了16英里/小时，空速为65英里/小时。今天天气晴朗，高空有点雾，但总的来说还是不错的。FlightAware数据跟踪。#TeaganAir #飞行员 #飞行 #pa28 #飞行训练 这事真的就像去健身房一样。我今天睡了两个小时的午觉（刚醒），因为我身体很疲惫。我也真的很酸痛，尤其是我的腿。今天用了很多右舵。

source: Imagine a very long web page with lots of sections (e.g., single-page HTML spec). If the user requests a specific section (e.g. page.html#section7), what if the web server streamed that section first and the other sections after that? Stream order: 1. start of HTML document up to <body> 2. HTML for section 7 3. HTML for section 1, 2, 3, etc. The browser would then make sure to insert the sections 1 to 6 *above* section 7 on the web page. Does this make sense? Would this be useful? What I want to achieve is have the linked section (#section7) render as fast as possible without having to re-implement stuff with JavaScript. I just want to have a super long HTML document but still have linked sections render as fast as possible. It should just work with HTML.
hypothesis: 想象一下一个非常长的网页，包含很多章节（例如，单页HTML规范）。如果用户请求一个特定章节（例如，page.html#section7），如果网络服务器首先流式传输该章节，然后再传输其他章节，会怎么样？流顺序：1. HTML文档的开头直到<body> 2. 第7节的HTML 3. 第1、2、3等节的HTML。浏览器然后会确保将第1到第6节插入到网页上第7节的*上方*。这有意义吗？这有用吗？我想要实现的是让链接的章节（#section7）尽可能快地呈现，而无需使用JavaScript重新实现任何东西。我只想拥有一个超长的HTML文档，但仍然让链接的章节尽可能快地呈现。它应该只使用HTML。
reference: 想象一下，一个网页很长，有很多个部分（比如单页的 HTML 规范）。如果用户请求其中的某个特定部分（比如 page.html#section7），Web 服务器能不能先把这个部分传输过去，然后再传输其他部分呢？ 流顺序： 1. HTML 文档开头，直至 <body> 标签 2. 第7部分的 HTML 代码 3. 第1、2、3部分等的 HTML 代码 浏览器要确保将第1到第6部分插入到网页上第7部分的上方。 这样合理吗？会有用吗？ 我想实现的目标是让链接的部分（#section7）尽快渲染出来，而不用 JavaScript 之类的东西重新实现。我想要的是一个超长的 HTML 文档，但其中链接的部分仍然能够尽快渲染出来。只要用 HTML 就能实现。

source: And because of that, you cannot trust any media outlet to report on the news fairly or accurately. Now that being said, I still think there's some value to the mainstream media. The same is not necessarily true for the alternative media, the smaller companies or even individuals who talk about the news on sites like YouTube and Facebook.

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
hypothesis: 寒冷多雨的夜晚随之而来，我终于开始了迟来的散步——对于那些通过逃生或纯粹的运气而免受变异的人来说，探索帕尔特里克斯城是一种荣幸。城市的夜晚是美丽的，被闪烁的星星照亮，这些星星已经存在了数千年。它们在遥远的天空中一定很孤独。帕尔特里克斯是个不错的地方，但它给人的感觉更像是一个笼子，而不是一个豪华的居住地。这里到处都是公寓、住宅以及任何其他能够容纳居住者的建筑物，而且大多数建筑物都有数百层楼高；这要归功于伊格尼亚特。这种能够满足技术和建筑需求的矿物是一种伟大的矿物，它扩展了我们生命的基础。然而，公众对这种矿物的了解并不多，主要是因为它被严密地保护着。
reference: 夜已深，雨未停，我走了很久很久——对于那些逃过一劫或纯粹是靠运气躲过突变的人来说，能够有机会探索帕尔特里库斯这座城市，真是一种莫大的荣幸。帕尔特里库斯的夜晚很美，闪烁的繁星千年如一日地照耀着这座城市。在广阔无垠的夜空中，这些星星一定很孤独吧。帕尔特里库斯虽然环境不错，但感觉更像是一座囚笼，而不是美好的家园。城市里到处都是公寓、住宅和其他可以住人的建筑，大多数都有数百层高——这都多亏了 Ignniat 这种矿物。这种矿物不仅推动了科技的进步，还促进了建筑业的发展，巩固了人类的生存基础。然而，公众对这种矿物的了解却十分有限，因为它被严加看管着。

Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”

reference: 艾尔伯恩人很好，但这件事看起来很严重。我没有必要多管闲事，尤其是这些人似乎刚和城里所有的当权者闹过矛盾。但我还是无法完全放心。我默默叹了口气，慢慢掰弯下面的格栅，跳进了寂静的房间。“嘘。艾尔。艾尔！”我小声叫着他的名字。见他没有反应，又轻轻喊了一声。“莉莉丝？你怎么会在这里……？你快走，他会抓住你的。”

source: Isn’t that funny? We have half the manpower left, and we can’t even refrain from hurting one another. I hastily sped up, Al’s was around the corner, so I would be fine inside. A glance behind me ensured that I was no longer being tailed as I stood in front of a bright glowing sign that read, “Alborn’s Pawnshop!” With slower steps, I entered once again–this place was more under the cover, as Alborn would often take in people who’d been mutated and snuck into Paltricus. Upon opening the door, the lights had been shut off, interestingly enough–there was no Al. No refugees. Nothing. Something wasn’t right here.
hypothesis: 这难道不滑稽吗？我们只剩一半的人手了，却连避免互相伤害都做不到。我赶紧加快了脚步，拐角就是Al的地盘，待在那里我就安全了。回头一瞥，确定我没有再被跟踪后，我站在一个闪闪发光的招牌前，上面写着“Alborn当铺！”我放慢脚步，再次走了进去——这个地方更加隐蔽，因为Alborn经常接纳那些变异并偷溜进Paltricus的人。打开门后，灯竟然关了，真奇怪——没有Al，没有难民，什么都没有。这里有些不对劲。
reference: 有意思的是，我们现在的人数只剩下一半了，却仍然无法避免互相伤害。我加快了脚步，艾尔的当铺就在拐角处，只要进去就安全了。我站在一块写着“艾尔伯恩当铺”的明亮招牌前，回头看了一眼，确认没有人跟踪我。我放慢脚步，再次走了进去——这里更加安全，因为艾尔伯恩经常会收留一些偷偷潜入帕尔特里库斯的变异人。打开门后，我发现里面的灯都关了，更奇怪的是——艾尔伯恩不在店里。也没有难民。什么都没有。这里肯定发生了什么事情。

source: After changing into the small uniform, I helped around the bar a bit, it was pretty easy aside from the constant flirting and cat-calling from the people within the bar; but it didn’t really bother me that much to be honest. I’ll talk to Anton after this shift, I still really need to get Al off my mind, though I know I’ll still investigate his place after this, but still…
hypothesis: 换上那件小制服后，我在酒吧里帮忙做了一些事，除了酒吧里的人不断调情和吹口哨之外，其他都很容易；但老实说，这并没有真正困扰我。下班后我会和安东谈谈，我仍然需要把艾尔从我的脑海中赶走，虽然我知道下班后我仍然会调查他的住处，但是…
reference: 换好店里的制服后，我开始在酒吧里帮忙。除了时不时要跟客人调情，还要忍受客人们的嘘声之外，其他的都还好；不过说实话，这些对我来说也算不上什么烦恼。等这波客人走了之后，我要找安东谈谈。我真的很想把艾尔的事情抛到脑后，虽然我知道，忙完之后我还是会去他的店里看看。

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
hypothesis: “废话,” 我在心里默默地说. 我试图用开锁器打开缠绕在他手臂上的链条，此时，声音越来越近，隐约的脚步声也越来越大。“快！回到通风口，离开这里。不要回来。如果我们再见面，那肯定不会是在这个城市了。” 他匆忙地说，脸上闪过一丝恐慌，这让我更加紧张。我听从了他的建议，实在无法再待下去了。“该死，艾尔。” 我赶紧跑开了，离开通风口后，我感到很难过，失去这样一位宝贵的朋友真让人难受。他们要把他转移到……另一个城市吗？ 许多思绪在我有些混乱的脑海中闪过，其中大部分是愤怒和悲伤。我对外围城市，以及感染者首都——他们以监狱的名字命名的恶魔岛，做了大量的研究，从我读到的资料来看，我觉得这个名字非常贴切。更不用说，未突变者切断了所有与感染区域相连的陆地，这真是……太悲惨了。
reference: 我心里暗骂了一句。我正想办法撬开他手臂上的铁链，这时，有说话的声音朝我们这边走来，越来越近的脚步声也越来越清晰。“快！快回到通风管道里，然后离开这里。别再回来了。如果我们还能再见面，不会是在这座城市。”他匆匆忙忙地说道，脸上闪过一丝惊慌，我的神经也跟着紧绷起来。我听从了他的建议。我不能再待下去了。艾尔，你这个笨蛋。我从通风管道里爬出来，撒腿就跑。失去这样一位难得的朋友，我心里很难过。他们会把他转移到……另一座城市吗？我的思绪纷至沓来，大多是愤怒和悲伤。我曾经对帕尔特里库斯以外的城市以及感染者的首都——恶魔岛做过很多研究。恶魔岛的名字来源于那座监狱，从我读到的资料来看，这个名字取得很贴切。更不用说未感染者已经切断了与感染区的所有陆地联系，这真是……太悲惨了。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me. DETONATION JANUARY 19th, 2:34 PM, 2543.
hypothesis: 回家的路很安静，却又如此喧嚣。脑海中盘旋的思绪轰鸣作响，没留下帮忙的懊悔闪过无数次。我终于到家了，几乎要被这可怕的回家路弄哭了，天空中传来阵阵声响，雷鸣般的轰隆声有时足以吓到任何人。爸爸已经昏睡在沙发上，重播着一部老电影，大概有 10-12 年了；叹了口气，我悄悄地爬回了自己的房间。往床上一倒，我没能睁开眼睛多久。不久，睡意就向我袭来。“爆炸，1 月 19 日下午 2:34，2543。”
reference: 回家的路很安静，但我的内心却很喧嚣。各种想法萦绕在我的脑海里，后悔没有留下来帮忙的念头也反复出现。我终于到家了，一路上电闪雷鸣，震耳欲聋的雷声足以把人吓得哭出来。爸爸已经躺在沙发上睡着了，电视里正在播放一部十几年前的老电影。我叹了口气，悄悄地溜回了自己的房间。我一头倒在床上，很快就睡着了，眼皮沉得再也睁不开。 爆发 2543年1月19日，下午2点34分。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
hypothesis: 时光飞逝，我甚至还没来得及察觉。自从阿尔伯恩被带走已经过去几天了——我不知道他被带到哪里，但我知道他被带走了。那些服装看起来很眼熟，但我不可能第一次就弄清楚。叹了口气，我把手放在面前的系统上，系统发出红色和紫色的光芒——我可以破解安全系统，那个地方不远，而且我怀疑他们采取了什么措施……也许我不应该这样做。当然，违背了所有的道德，我的手指在不知不觉中移动，拉出了多个屏幕；天啊，我真厉害。我在几个网站上很受欢迎，他们称我为“WRAITH”，这真是个朗朗上口的名字。当然，我在任何网站上的名字都是WR417H，但我喜欢认为是公众想出了这个名字。
reference: 时间一天天过去，转眼间已经过去好几天了。艾尔伯恩被带走已经有一段时间了——我不知道他被带去了哪里，但他肯定就在某个地方。那些人的服装看起来很眼熟，但我一时之间想不起来是什么人。我叹了口气，双手在面前的系统上飞舞，屏幕上闪烁着红紫色的光芒——我可以黑进他们的安全系统，那地方离这里并不远，而且我怀疑他们并没有采取什么安全措施……也许我不应该这样做。当然，我的手指还是不受控制地在键盘上跳动，屏幕上弹出了好几个窗口。我的技术真不错。我在一些网站上很有名，他们叫我“幽灵”。这名字还挺酷的。其实我的网名一直都是 WR417H，不过我更愿意相信这是大家给我取的名字。

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
hypothesis: 反常地，安东酒吧非常繁忙，到处都是热闹的景象和我从未见过的陌生面孔——安东通常是唯一的员工，所以想到他一定压力很大。“嘿，酒保，给我来杯咖啡。” 我故意压低声音，想让他吃惊一下，看到他转过身来后松了一口气，我不禁轻笑出声。“天啊，莉莉丝，别吓我……” 他轻轻地说，显然很累。“你看起来很忙……需要帮忙吗？ 看起来这里人手充足。” 我叹了口气，我不想帮助这些醉汉，但想到让这家伙独自工作，我感到很内疚。“你能帮忙吗？ 我之后付你钱……” 他用小狗般的眼神望着我，恳求道。 高级战争战术……
reference: 安东的店里偶尔也会很忙，店里熙熙攘攘，挤满了许多我从未见过的新面孔——安东通常是店里唯一的服务员，所以我知道他肯定忙坏了。“嘿，酒保，给我来杯咖啡。”我故意压低声音，想吓吓他，看到他迅速转身后如释重负的样子，我不禁笑出了声。“我的天哪，莉莉丝，别这样……”他小声说道，显然是累坏了。“你看起来很忙……需要帮忙吗？店里人很多啊。”我有点生气地说。我可不想伺候这些醉鬼，但我也不想让他一个人忙里忙外。 “可以吗？我等会儿付你钱……”他可怜巴巴地望着我说道。这招真是太厉害了……

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back. "Come on, Tenuk, you've shapeshifted into a Thraki before!" "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!" "It's not that bad, right, Kayel?" Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
hypothesis: 火焰从萨萨林的嘴里喷涌而出，巨大的斯拉基点燃了一片特定的森林，然后在上空盘旋，观察了一会儿。奇怪的是，当他慢下来时，从他身后传来的奇怪尖叫声停止了。萨萨林已经忘记了他的背上还有乘客。“别这样，特努克，你以前也变成过斯拉基！““我自己的飞行和被一头巨大的粉红色巨龙突然拖走是很不一样的！”“没那么糟吧，凯尔？”凯尔显然不同意尼西的说法，他看起来比平时更不黑了，他的爪子深深地陷进了萨萨林的背部，以至于斯拉基都流血了，但萨萨林显然并不在意。话虽如此，萨萨林意识到他吓到了他的新朋友，并找到了一片空地降落。
reference: 萨萨林喷出一股火焰，这个高大的斯拉克人将一小片森林点燃，然后在这上空盘旋，观察着时机。奇怪的是，当他放慢速度时，身后传来的怪异尖叫声也停止了。萨萨林忘了背上还有乘客。 “拜托，特努克，你以前又不是没变形成过斯拉克人！” “自己飞和突然被一条巨大的粉红色龙拖走可是两码事！” “还好吧，卡耶尔？” 卡耶尔显然不同意尼西的说法，他看起来比平时苍白，他的爪子已经深深地扎进了萨萨林的背上，把斯拉克人都抓出了血，但萨萨林显然并不在意。话虽如此，萨萨林还是意识到自己吓到了新朋友，于是找了一块空地降落。

source: A burst of laughter interrupted them. Thassalin was suddenly overly amused, but no one could work out what he was laughing about. It took a little too long for Thassalin to calm down. "I AM SORRY, BUT I PICTURED YOUR LARGE, ARMOURED FRIEND ON A TINY LITTLE BIKE MEANT FOR TEMTHAN CHILDREN. IT WAS HILARIOUS! I WISH I HAD SOME FORM OF TELEPATHY. IT IS A CHERISHED THOUGHT! ONE I CANNOT SHARE!" Kayel snickered, as he could imagine what Thassalin was thinking about. "Yeah, fair. But what did you pick up, and why did you fly off so quickly?"
hypothesis: 一阵笑声打断了他们。萨萨林突然觉得非常好笑，但没人能明白他在笑什么。萨萨林过了好一会儿才平静下来。“我很抱歉，但我想到你那位身材高大、身穿盔甲的朋友骑在一辆专门给腾坦儿童设计的小自行车上。太搞笑了！我希望我能有某种形式的 telepathy。这是一个珍贵的想法！一个我无法分享的想法！”凯尔窃笑，因为他能想象到萨萨林在想什么。“好吧，算你说的对。但你捡到了什么，又为什么要飞走得那么快？”

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway. With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
hypothesis: 将监控转移到我的手机上，我 внимательно 观看每一个。什么也没有。他们好像从来没有在那里出现过一样。这太说不通了。摄像头有严密的安保，即使是远程访问也是如此。怎么会……？啊！我生气地站起来，准备摆脱一些想法——我走过去，趿拉上鞋子，拿起钥匙。“我很快回来，爸爸。”沉默。随便吧，反正他通常不回应，他可能正忙着做比我更重要的事情。突然，我感到一阵寒意传遍我的脊椎，当我走出公寓时；真奇怪。我忽略了这种感觉，催促自己去 Al 那里调查一下，但我的腿却走向了 Anton 的小酒吧——那里非常安静，我绝对需要找人聊聊。还有谁比欠你东西的酒保更好呢？
reference: 我把监控画面转移到我的移动设备上，专心致志地查看每一个画面。什么都没有。这些人就好像从来没有出现过一样。这说不通啊。摄像头的安全防护很严密，即使是远程访问也是如此。怎么会这样？啊！我气愤地站起身，准备出去走走，好让自己不去想这些烦心事——我走过去，穿上鞋，拿起钥匙。“我很快回来，爸爸。”回应我的只有沉默。算了，他通常都不回答，反正他可能正在忙着比我更重要的事情。 我猛地打了个冷战，一股寒意顺着脊背传遍全身；真是奇怪的感觉。我没有理会这种感觉，而是催促着自己赶紧去艾尔的当铺调查一番，但我的双腿却不由自主地朝着安东的小酒吧走去——那是一个非常宁静的地方，而我确实需要找个人聊聊。还有什么人比欠你人情的酒保更合适呢？

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!" "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?" "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid." "Yeah but can Retvik drive?" Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive." "Have you ever seen Retvik drive a vehicle? He doesn't own a truck like you do, nor have I seen him drive something like that little cute car Kayel has, and he only started going to work by car because you keep on driving us TO work. He just has that bike of his."
hypothesis: “我很抱歉，但我闻到气味了，我必须处理一下！” “非得把我们都拖上吗？”泰努克从萨萨林的背上爬下来，顺着他的尾巴滑下来，没好气地说。“我们还把雷特维克落下了！我们抛弃了我们又高又壮、能打的家伙！他要怎么才能找到我们？”“他会解决的……”尼斯西啧了一声。“雷特维克是慢，但他不笨。”“是没错，但雷特维克会开车吗？”尼斯西眨了眨眼，转头看向泰努克。“他当然会开车。”“你见过雷特维克开过车吗？他没有像你一样的卡车，也没见过他开过像凯尔那样的小可爱车，而且他开始开车上班，还不是因为你一直开车送我们上班。他只有那辆自行车。”
reference: “抱歉抱歉，我闻到了一股气味。我得处理一下！” “你非得把我们也一起拖来吗？”特努克从萨萨林背上爬下来，顺着尾巴滑到地上，语气尖锐地问道。“我们把雷特维克丢下了！我们抛弃了那个强壮好斗的大块头！他要怎么才能找到我们？” “他会想办法的……”尼西啧啧称是。“雷特维克是反应慢，但不傻。” “那雷特维克会开车吗？” 尼西眨了眨眼睛，转头看向特努克。“他当然会开车。” “你见过雷特维克开过车吗？他没有你那样的卡车，我也没见过他开过像卡耶尔那样的可爱小汽车，他开始坐车上班纯粹是因为你总是开车送我们去上班。他只有一辆自行车。”

source: Thassalin responded to this attack by grabbing Nyssi and throwing her on his back with his insanely long, dextrous tail, before taking off into the air. The black, two-winged creature quickly chased after them. Kayel tutted as he drew his rifle from his back, then opened up a pouch, revealing a bandolier. He slung the bandolier over his chest for easy access, but quickly realized that Nyssi, the Thraki and the monster were no longer visible. "Hey, Tenuk, do you mind shapeshifting into something that can fly?" Kayel asked. "You want to chase after them?" "Yeah, duh." "But... one of them is a giant monster!" "So? I have a high-powered rifle in my hands, right now, ready to go. I just need to be able to, you know, see it, so I can shoot it."
hypothesis: 塔萨林回应这次袭击，用他那长得离谱又灵巧的尾巴抓住奈西，把她扔到自己背上，然后起飞到空中。那只黑色的双翼生物迅速追了上去。凯尔咂了咂嘴，从背后抽出步枪，然后打开一个袋子，露出了一个弹药带。他将弹药带挂在胸前，以便取用，但很快意识到奈西、萨拉基和怪物都不见了。“嘿，特努克，你介意变成能飞的东西吗？”凯尔问道。“你想追他们吗？”“是啊，废话。”“但是……他们其中一个是巨大的怪物！”“那又怎样？我现在手里拿着一把大功率步枪，准备好了。我只需要能够，你知道，看到它，这样我才能射击它。”
reference: 萨萨林一把抓住尼西，用它那长而灵巧的尾巴把她扔到背上，然后腾空而起。那只长着两对翅膀的黑色生物迅速追了上来。 卡耶尔啧了一声，从背后抽出步枪，又打开袋子，拿出一条子弹带。他把子弹带挂在胸前，方便取用，但很快意识到尼西、萨萨林和怪物都不见了踪影。 “嘿，特努克，你能不能变身成会飞的动物？”卡耶尔问道。 “你想追上去？” “废话。” “但是……他们中的一个是巨型怪物啊！” “那又怎样？我手里这把步枪火力强劲，随时可以开火。我只需要看见它，就能把它打下来。”

source: Thassalin grunted, took off and disappeared briefly, before returning, dropping a carcass in front of Nyssi. It was an Orothrack, a very rare, gold and white draconic creature. But its head was missing. "ANOTHER DEAD ONE. I HEAR THEIR CRIES. SMELL THEIR BLOOD. I AM DRAWN TO PROTECT AND HUNT. AS YISINI DEMANDS. THE CREATURES, THEY ARE CLOSE." The mighty Thraki suddenly froze. Nyssi and Kayel also froze, their attention drawn to a gap in the clearing. Something large and black was staring at them, hissing. Whatever it was, it spread open two colossal pairs of wings and charged forward, aiming at Thassalin, not caring that it had to go through the three smaller beings. Kayel and Tenuk only just managed to get to cover, but Nyssi found herself dragged along and almost thrown at Thassalin.
hypothesis: 塔萨林哼了一声，起飞后短暂消失，然后返回，将一具尸体扔在妮丝面前。那是一只奥罗斯拉克，一种非常稀有、金色和白色的龙形生物。但是它的头不见了。“又死了一个。我听到它们的哭声。闻到它们的血腥味。我被吸引去保护和狩猎。正如伊西尼所要求的。那些生物，它们很近了。” 强大的斯拉基突然僵住了。妮丝和凯尔也僵住了，他们的注意力被空地上的一个缺口吸引。一个巨大的黑色物体盯着他们，发出嘶嘶声。不管那是什么，它张开了两对巨大的翅膀，向前冲去，目标是塔萨林，不在乎它必须穿过三个较小的生物。凯尔和泰努克勉强设法找到了掩护，但妮丝发现自己被拖着走，几乎被扔向塔萨林。
reference: 萨萨林哼了一声，起飞后很快就消失了，然后又飞了回来，在尼西面前丢下一具尸体。那是一头奥罗萨拉克，一种非常罕见的金白色龙族生物。但它的头不见了。“又死了一个。我听到了它们的哭喊。闻到了它们的血腥味。我必须保护它们，猎杀凶手。这是伊西尼的旨意。那些生物就在附近。” 强大的斯拉克人突然僵住了。尼西和卡耶尔也僵住了，他们的注意力被空地边缘的一个缺口所吸引。一个巨大而漆黑的东西正盯着他们，发出嘶嘶声。这东西猛地张开两对巨大的翅膀，向前冲去，目标直指萨萨林，丝毫不在意挡在它和萨萨林之间的三个小家伙。卡耶尔和特努克勉强躲到了一边，但尼西却发现自己被带倒在地，几乎被甩到了萨萨林身上。

source: Tenuk hesitated, then stepped back, giving himself some space. With a low, slightly pained grunt, Tenuk's body stretched out, his fur replaced with scales and his arms replaced with wings. He quickly turned himself into a normal, light blue Thraki, but his eyes remained red. "Climb on." Being a more normal-looking Thraki, Tenuk now had proper plates of scales running down his back, but he'd also conveniently grown a pair of spikes on his back for Kayel to hold on to. It took a little too long for Tenuk to get airborne, but once he was in the air, he quickly orientated himself and tried to give chase. However, Tenuk and Kayel quickly realized they weren't alone. A second dark creature shot out from beneath them, and Tenuk only just managed to avoid a collision.
hypothesis: 特努克犹豫了一下，后退了几步，给自己留出一些空间。他低声痛苦地咕哝了一声，特努克的身体伸展开来，皮毛变成了鳞片，手臂变成了翅膀。他迅速变回了普通的淡蓝色瑟拉奇，但眼睛仍然是红色的。“上来。” 变回更像瑟拉奇的形态后，特努克的背上长出了整片的鳞甲，而且还很方便地在背上长出了一对尖刺，供凯尔抓住。特努克起飞花了太长时间，但一旦升空，他迅速调整方向，试图追赶。然而，特努克和凯尔很快意识到他们不是孤身一人。第二个黑暗生物从他们下方冲出，特努克险些避开了一次撞击。
reference: 特努克犹豫了一下，然后退后一步，给自己留出一些空间。随着一声低沉而略带痛苦的呻吟，特努克的身体伸展开来，皮毛变成了鳞片，手臂变成了翅膀。他很快就变成了普通的浅蓝色斯拉克人，但眼睛仍然是红色的。 “上来吧。” 特努克现在看起来是比较普通的斯拉克人，背上已经长出排列整齐的鳞甲，还长出一对尖刺，方便卡耶尔抓住。特努克花了很长时间才飞起来，但一旦升空，他就迅速调整方向，努力追赶。 然而，特努克和卡耶尔很快意识到他们并非只有一个对手。第二头黑暗怪物从他们下方窜出，特努克勉强躲过撞击。

source: Up ahead, Nyssi was clinging on for dear life as Thassalin flailed around, blasting the blackened monster with bursts of flame. While the creature was definitely injured, it seemed very pissed off and unwilling to back off, and the fire balls didn't seem to be doing as much as they should. As Thassalin straightened himself out though, Nyssi took this as an opportunity to pull out her own weapon, a trusty shotgun. Sure, it wasn't meant for this sort of thing, but surely the scattershot would at least deter the black beast?
hypothesis: 在前方，尼西为了保命紧紧抓住不放，而萨萨林则胡乱挥舞着，用火焰冲击着那只被烧焦的怪物。虽然那怪物显然受伤了，但它似乎非常恼火，不愿退缩，而且火球似乎没有起到应有的作用。不过，当萨萨林站直身体时，尼西抓住这个机会掏出了自己的武器，一把可靠的霰弹枪。当然，这枪不是为这种场合准备的，但散射弹至少应该能阻止那只黑色野兽吧？
reference: 前方，萨萨林正疯狂地挥舞着身体，向黑色的怪物喷出火焰，尼西则拼命抓住萨萨林，以免掉下去。虽然这头怪物肯定受伤了，但它似乎被激怒了，不愿退缩，而火球似乎也没有造成太大的伤害。萨萨林稳住身体后，尼西趁机掏出武器，那是一把她信赖的霰弹枪。当然，霰弹枪对付不了这种怪物，但散射的子弹至少可以吓退这头黑色的野兽吧？

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night. No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it. "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
hypothesis: creature
reference: 怪物咆哮着，喉咙里发出嘶嘶的声音，径直向上飞去，嘴里还不停地向空中喷吐着什么。突然间，四周变得漆黑一片，仿佛怪物正在吸取天空中的光线，并用永恒的黑夜取而代之。 萨萨林眼前一黑，试图后退，但发现自己撞上了树梢，然后摔落到空地上。怪物似乎清楚地知道萨萨林掉在哪里，径直朝他飞去，并将那团乌云也带了过去。 “卡耶尔！”特努克一边大喊，一边飞出乌云，开始盘旋，试图在下面的黑暗中找到尼西和萨萨林。“我们该怎么办？卡耶尔……？卡耶尔，你在哪里？”

source: "I guess that's the other big scary monster that Lanex was worried about?" Kayel frowned as he attempted to take a shot at the second beast, missed and swiftly reloaded. Tenuk didn't respond, he was too busy concentrating on flying towards Nyssi and Thassalin, even though the other creature was chasing them. Kayel awkwardly turned himself around, so he could face the monster. The fact that it was giving chase was good news in Kayel's eyes, as it made it easier for him to aim and fire. Two shots passed through the creature's top wings, and it roared in pain, disappearing back below the trees. Whether it was still following them, Kayel wasn't sure, but it certainly wouldn't have been able to keep up.
hypothesis: 我猜这就是拉尼克斯担心的另一个可怕的大怪物？凯尔皱着眉头，试图射击第二个野兽，但没打中，迅速重新装弹。泰努克没有回应，他正忙于集中精力飞向尼西和塔萨林，即使另一个生物正在追赶他们。凯尔笨拙地转过身，以便面对那个怪物。在凯尔看来，它正在追赶的事实是个好消息，因为它使他更容易瞄准和射击。两枪穿过了那个生物的顶部翅膀，它痛苦地咆哮着，消失在树下。凯尔不确定它是否还在跟踪他们，但它肯定无法跟上。
reference: “我猜这就是拉内克斯担心的另一个可怕的大怪物吧？”卡耶尔皱着眉头，试图向第二头怪物开枪，却没有击中，他迅速重新装弹。 特努克没有回应，他正忙着朝尼西和萨萨林飞去，尽管另一头怪物正在追赶他们。卡耶尔笨拙地转过身，面对怪物。怪物正在追赶，卡耶尔认为这是一个好消息，因为他更容易瞄准和射击。两发子弹射穿了怪物的上翼，它痛苦地咆哮着，消失在树林里。卡耶尔不确定它是否还在跟着他们，但他觉得它肯定跟不上了。

source: It took a moment for Nyssi to work out what had happened. They were all aware that Kayel had weird shadow powers, ones that he rarely used because most considered them unholy and rather terrifying. But Nyssi didn't know that Kayel could use those powers in any sort of darkness. And, by the way Kayel was acting, he was pretty surprised as well. "You alright?" Nyssi couldn't help but ask. "Yeah, I'm fine. I killed something, I'll be good in a minute." Kayel examined his handiwork, as Tenuk made his way down and landed next to him, shapeshifting back into his normal Spast form.
hypothesis: 尼西花了一会儿才弄明白发生了什么事。他们都知道凯尔有奇怪的暗影力量，但他很少使用这些力量，因为大多数人认为它们是不洁的，而且非常可怕。但尼西不知道凯尔可以在任何黑暗中使用这些力量。而且，从凯尔的反应来看，他自己也很惊讶。“你没事吧？” 尼西忍不住问道。“没事，我杀了个东西，一会儿就好。” 凯尔检查了他的杰作，这时特努克走了下来，落在他旁边，变回了他通常的斯帕斯特形态。
reference: 过了一会儿，尼西才明白发生了什么事。他们都知道卡耶尔拥有诡异的暗影能力，但他很少使用这种能力，因为大多数人都认为这种能力非常邪恶，而且很可怕。但是尼西不知道卡耶尔可以在任何黑暗中使用这种能力。而且，从卡耶尔的表现来看，他自己也非常惊讶。 “你没事吧？”尼西忍不住问道。 “我没事。我杀死了那东西，我很快就会好起来的。”卡耶尔看了看自己的“杰作”，这时，特努克落在他旁边，变回了原来的斯巴斯特形态。

source: A gunshot suddenly filled the air, and the monster fell silent, collapsing on the ground and remaining still. The darkness all around them dissipated, revealing what had happened. Standing on top of the creature was Kayel, holding his rifle and breathing heavily. "That was... one of the weirder shadowjumps I've ever done... Thanto kat'olon..." Kayel gasped for air. His eyes somehow were glowing black, and a dark energy drifted across his body. However, as he spoke, the colour returned to Kayel's organic plating and his eyes turned back to their normal yellow.
hypothesis: 枪声骤然响彻天空，怪物随即silent，倒在地上，一动不动。周围的darkness消散，露出了所发生的事情。凯尔站在那生物的顶端，手里拿着rifle，heavy breathing。“那真是……我做过的最奇怪的shadowjump之一了……Thanto kat'olon……”凯尔gasp for air。他的眼睛不知何故发着黑光，一股dark energy在他的身体上飘过。然而，当他说完话，颜色回到了凯尔的organic plating上，他的眼睛也恢复了normal yellow.
reference: 突然，一声枪响划破空气，怪物顿时安静下来，倒在地上不动了。周围的黑暗消散了，显露出事情的真相。卡耶尔站在怪物的尸体上，手里拿着步枪，气喘吁吁。 “那是……这是我做过的最奇怪的暗影跳跃之一……坦托·卡特奥隆……”卡耶尔喘着粗气说道。不知何故，他的眼睛闪着黑光，一股黑暗能量在他体内涌动。但就在卡耶尔开口说话之际，他的有机盔甲恢复了颜色，眼睛也变回了正常的黄色。

source: "Oops..." Retvik muttered from the driver's seat, before awkwardly switching the engine off and climbing out of the truck. "I, uh, did not mean to do that. Are you all well?" "You missed basically all the action!" Tenuk tutted. "Where were you?" "You all did somewhat leave me behind. I got here as quickly as I could..." Retvik sighed. "May I ask, what are those horrible things?" Retvik's question was thankfully answered by Thassalin, who had picked himself back up. He was covered in cuts and scratches and seemed a bit dazed, but he didn't seem too badly injured. "YOU KILLED THE CORRUPTIIDS! THE INFECTED MONSTERS. CREATURES LEFT HERE WHEN THE CORRUPTION ATTACKED YOUR GODS." "You mean... the horrible god monster thing that we... helped kill?" Tenuk stuttered.
hypothesis: “哎呀……” Retvik 在驾驶座上嘟囔着，笨拙地关掉引擎并爬出卡车。“我，呃，不是故意要这么做的。你们都还好吗？” “你基本上错过了所有的行动！” Tenuk 啧了一声。“你跑哪儿去了？” “是你们把我落下了。我尽我所能地赶来了……” Retvik 叹了口气。“请问，那些可怕的东西是什么？” 幸运的是，Thassalin 回答了 Retvik 的问题，他已经重新站了起来。他浑身都是割伤和擦伤，看起来有点茫然，但似乎伤得不重。“你们杀死了腐化体！那些受感染的怪物。当腐化侵袭你们的神时，留在这里的生物。” “你是说……我们……帮忙杀死的那个可怕的怪物？” Tenuk 结结巴巴地说。
reference: “哎呦……”雷特维克坐在驾驶座上嘟囔着，然后笨拙地关掉引擎，爬下卡车。“呃，我不是故意的。你们都没事吧？” “你错过了所有的好戏！”特努克啧啧说道。“你跑哪儿去了？” “是你们把我落下的。我已经尽力赶过来了……”雷特维克叹了口气说道。“请问，这些可怕的东西是什么？” 雷特维克的问题得到了萨萨林的解答，他已经站了起来。他浑身都是伤口和抓痕，看起来有点晕乎乎的，但伤势似乎并不严重。 “你杀死了腐化者！那些被感染的怪物。当腐化袭击你们的神的时候，这些生物都被留在了这里。” “你是说……我们……帮忙杀死了可怕的怪物神？”特努克有点结巴。

source: Now that the creature was no longer moving, they could better see what it was. Its skin was pitch black and slimy, but the slime remained firmly attached to the creature's body. It had four wings and four limbs, all of which were tipped with long, thin talons, and two straight horns stuck out from its skull. Before Tenuk and Kayel could ask what the fuck they were looking at, something screeched and leaped out from a nearby bush. However, it never made contact, as a familiar vehicle crashed into the side of it, causing the monster to skid to a halt by Nyssi's feet. Not taking any chances, Nyssi grabbed her shotgun and immediately fired into its skull, killing the creature instantly.
hypothesis: 既然那怪物不再动弹，他们就能更好地看清它是什么了。它的皮肤漆黑黏腻，但黏液牢牢地附着在怪物的身体上。它有四个翅膀和四肢，都长着又长又细的爪子，头骨上伸出两根笔直的角。 在Tenuk和Kayel来得及问他们到底在看什么之前，有什么东西尖叫着从附近的灌木丛里跳了出来。 然而，它并没有接触到目标，因为一辆熟悉的车辆撞到了它的侧面，导致怪物在Nyssi的脚边猛然停住。 尼西没有冒险，抓起她的猎枪，立即射击它的头骨，当场杀死了那怪物。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power.
